qas.question: A movie adaptation of the book was released in what year?
Who played Atticus Finch in the 1962 movie of the same title?
Which actor received An Oscar for his role of Atticus Finch in the 1962 movie of the book?

context: The book was made into the well-received <a0_0>1962<a0_0/> film with the same title, starring <a1_0><a2_0>Gregory Peck<a2_0/><a1_0/> as Atticus Finch. The film's producer, Alan J. Pakula, remembered Universal Pictures executives questioning him about a potential script: "They said, 'What story do you plan to tell for the film?' I said, 'Have you read the book?' They said, 'Yes.' I said, 'That's the story.'" The movie was a hit at the box office, quickly grossing more than $20 million from a $2-million budget. It won three Oscars: Best Actor for Gregory Peck, Best Art Direction-Set Decoration, Black-and-White, and Best Writing, Screenplay Based on Material from Another Medium for Horton Foote. It was nominated for five more Oscars including Best Actress in a Supporting Role for Mary Badham, the actress who played Scout.
